feature.name: Sorcerous Origin: Disco Soul (HB)
feature.text:
The Disco Soul Sorcerer channels the power of rhythm and melody, transforming the battlefield into a dance floor where magic syncs with music. With the Legend of the Ones and Twos, they weave cantrips into their spellcasting, offering protective harmonies and groovy defenses to their allies.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 15 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Legend of the Ones and Twos (Disco Soul (HB))
feature.text:
Upon choosing this subclass at 1st level, you gain proficiency with musical instruments, which can be used as your spellcasting focus. Additionally, you learn the Dancing Lights and Minor Illusion cantrips I you don't already know them. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can simultaneously cast a cantrip that doesn't deal damage as part of the same action. Doing so grants you and any allies within 30 feet a +1 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 15 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Groovy Guard (Disco Soul (HB))
feature.text:
You learn the Blade Ward and Resistance cantrips. As a reaction when you take damage, you can cast Blade Ward on yourself. Alternatively, you can cast Resistance on an ally within 30 feet as a reaction to them taking damage.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 15 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Let The Bass Drop (Disco Soul (HB))
feature.text:
Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level o 2nd level, you can also cast Thunderwave at 5th level as part of the same action, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, the bonus to AC granted by The Ones and Twos increases to +2 permanently.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 15 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Eternal Encore (Disco Soul (HB))
feature.text:
Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can initiate an Eternal Encore for 1 minute. During this time, you can use Legend of the Ones and Twos without expending a use of the feature, and the AC bonus increases to +3. Cantrips cast on you or an ally grant temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier, and cantrips that deal damage deal additional thunder damage equal to your Charisma modifier. Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 15 (Homebrew)
